content.description:
Start sitting in the dihedral to the right of the weakness in the wall that leads up to Island Fever.  Hands will go on two slopey, vertical rails, feet will be awkwardly off to the right.  Pull on and fire to a large crimp to the left, then head up and right to top out.



Instead of going up the weakness in the wall to Island Fever, go immediately past it to the right.  The dihedral is fairly obvious.

Clean landing

Start sitting and climb the prow just to the left of the Skipper from low slopers to better holds.



To the left of the Skipper's dihedral is a short face with a distinct prow. 

Clean landing

Start standing with hands in the giant, horizontal flake.  Go straight up through pods in a horizontal crack and a crimpy sidepull to gain a quartz knob and a very positive topout.



To climber's left and slightly uphill from Island Fever.  It is immediately left of the choss jumble that separates the two.

Clean fall.

A small wall above and to the right of the Skipper dihedral.  There is a small, crumbly dihedral feature in it.  Climb the face immediately right of it without reaching into this feature.  Start sitting and very low with underclinging/sidepulling flakes.  Pull up and fire to a large ledge, then go to the top.



Facing the Skipper, walk to the right until there's an obvious break in the rock wall and walk up it.  This is the short face at the top of it.

Clean landing

A standalone boulder shaped vaguely like an arrowhead to the right of the Boreal Beach Vacation dihedral.  Start sitting with hands on two very small crimps in right-leaning cracks in the centre of the face facing in the general direction of the dihedral.  Scum your feet onto whatever you can find without dabbing on the little detached block on the right.  Throw up and left to the edge of the boulder.  A great one-move wonder.



An obvious detached, arrowhead-shaped block closely climber's right of the BBV dihedral.

Clean landing

Slightly downhill from the BBV dihedral, right on the edge of the muskeg.  Start sitting and climb the obvious crack.



Slightly downhill from and to the right of the BBV dihedral.

Clean fall

Climb the obvious, excellent dihedral crack toward the "left" of the bouldering area.



If you're facing the bouldering face of Gilligan's Island, it'll be the first route on your "left".  The dihedral is fairly easy to spot if you're standing a bit out in the clearing in the muskeg in front of the bouldering area.

Clean fall, but avoid the watery depressions around it.

A small "island" sticking out of the muskeg that forms the former river course.  The "front" (the first part you'll see on the approach) contains a few detached boulders and faces you can make use of, though it is a little lowball-heavy.
